data.title: Lithuanian film center
meta_keywords: lietuviu kino informacijos ir sklaidos biuras
data.text:
Was born in Shiauliai, Lithuania in 1964.

Artistic director of film studio „Banga“ in Kaunas, Lithuania, from 1984.

Entered the film school VGIK in Moscow in 1986 and graduated in 1991, Irakli Kvirikadze master class.

Founded the film studio „Kinema“ - the first independant film studio in Lithuania in 1989.

Filmography:

As the director:

In The memory of A Day Gone By/ Praėjusios dienos atminimui, 1990, 35 mm, 40 min., b & w, documentary

Festivals/awards:

1990 - Pesaro; Kijev Molodostj (Grand Prix); Karlovy Vary Int. Film Fest; Int. Film Fest. Rotterdam; Lodz Film Fest; Int. Documentary Film Fest Amsterdam (Special Jury Prize, Audience Award); Int. Film Forum “Arsenals” Riga; Marseille ” Vue Sur Les Docs” (France).

1993 - Niepokalanov (Best Documentary Film).

1996 - Cinéma Du Réel ( Paris,; Leipzig Int. Doc. Films Fest; Gdansk Film Fest.(); Nordische Filmtage Lubeck .

1997 - Cinéma Du Réel, Nancy “Eole Cine”; Anthology Film Archives in New York - Retrospective; Die Film Fest .

Screenings in Paris, Rouen, Locarno, Lubeck, London , etc.

Three Days/ Trys dienos, 1991, 35 mm, 76 min., color, feature

Festivals:

1991 - Montreal Int. Film Fest, Festival du Film de Geneve; Festival Internazionale Cinema Giovani (Turin, Italy).

1992 - Oporto Int. Film Fest. ( Portugal) (Grand Prix); Berlin (Prize of the Ecumenical Jury, Special Mention of FIPRESCI); San Fracisko Int. Film Fest; Seattle Film Fest; Int. Film Forum “Arsenals” (Riga); Festival du Film de Dunkerque (Grand Prix).

1993 - Int. Film Fest Bruxelles; Festival du Cinéma Nordique (Rouen, France); Rotterdam Int. Film Fest; Honk Kong Film Fest; Calcutta Int Film Fest; European Film Academy -.Nomination of Felix’92 for the Young European Film Of The Year.

1996 - Leipzig Film Fest.; Gdansk Film Fest.

1997 - Alpe Adria Cinema (Italy).

Screenings in Paris, Niepokalanow, Lubek, Wienn, etc.

The Corridor/ Koridorius, 1995, 35 mm, 2400 m, 80 min., b & w, feature

Festivals:

1995 - 45 Internationale Filmestspiele Berlin, Panorama; Cannes , Market; Int. Thessaloniki Film Fest.- Competition; Festival Internazionale Cinema Giovani ( Turin, ) - Competition (CICAE Award); V’iennale - Competition (FIPRESZI Award); Stockholm Int. Film Fest; Oslo Film Fest.

1996 - Int. Film Fest. Rotterdam; Karlovy Vary Int. Film Fest; Int. Film Forum “Arsenals” (Riga); “Kinoshok” (Anapa); Gdansk Fest; L’Alternativa (Barcelona , Spain).

1997 - Grenzland Filmtage (Germany); Anthology Film Archives in New York - Retrospective; Die Film Fest.(France); Alpe Adria Cinema - Incontri Con Il Cinema Dell’Europa Centro - Orientale (Italy), etc.

Few of Us/ Mūsų nedaug, 1996, 35mm, 105 min., color, fiction

Festivals:

1996 - cannes - Selection Officielle “Un Certain Regard”;

Bruxelles Int. Film Fest (Prix de l’Age d’or);v’iennale; kinoshok (award for the best direction, critic’s award); Haifa Int. Film Festival (Israel); Sao Paolo Int. Film Fest; Reminicinema Mostra Internazionale (Italy; International thessaloniki Film Festival (Greece);tokyo International Film Fest; festival internacional de cine de mar del plata (argentina).

1997 - goteborg Flm Festival; Hong Kong Int. Film Festival; Forum du Cinéma Européen de Strasbourg; Filmfest Hamburg; Hela Sveriges Film Festival (); Cinema Jove Festival ( – ), etc.

The House / Namai, 1997, 35 mm, color, 120 min., feature film

Festivals:

1997 - Cannes - Selection Officielle “Un Certain Regard”;25e festival International du film de la Rochelle; Forum du Cinéma Européen du cinéma de Strasbourg; Festival de Viareggio; Taormina Arte (Italy); Baltijas Perle (Latvia);

Alpe Adria Cinema - Retrospective; Festival International du Film de Flandre - Gand; Tokyo Int. Film Fest; Sao Paulo Int. Film Fest; Festival International de Cine de Mar del Plata (Argentina); Auteurs Film Festival (Belgrad); Camerimage (Poland).

Freedom / Laisvė, 2000, 35 mm, color, 94 min., feature film

Festivals/ awards:

Premiere – Venice film festival, 2000, awarded with the special prize Cinema Avvenire;

Prize of Lithuanian filmmakers union, 2000

International TV and Film forum „Together“ in Yalta, . Award for the visual solution of the year, 2001;

Lithuanian National Prize for Culture and Arts to the director Šarūnas Bartas, 2001

International cinema forum “Arsenal”, Riga, , 2000

International Thoronto film festival, 2000

International Sao Paulo film festival, 2000

International Stokholm film festival, , 2000

International London film festival, , 2000

International Belgrad film festival, , 2000

International TV and film forum „Together“ in Yalta, , 2000

International Rotherdam film festival, contest, Holand, 2001

International Triest film festival , 2001

2004 -“Nieko nepraranda vaikai”/ “Children loose nothing” – short vido film, segment of “Vision of Europe”, World premier in Copenhagen IFF;

Seven Invisible Men/ Septyni nematomi žmonės, 2005, 35 mm, color, feature film, 116 min, Dolby SRD

Festivals/ awards:

Film premier in Cannes film festival, programme „ Directors' Fortnight“ 2005

„NVS and Baltic states “ film festival “Kinoshok“. Award for the best camera work, prize of Aleksandr Kniazinski, 2005

„NVS and Baltic states“ film festival in Baku, Azarbaijan. Award for contribution to Eurasian cinematography, 2005

Eastern Drift/ Eurazijos aborigenas (Original title: "Indigen d'Eurasie"), 2010, 35 mm, color feature film, Dolby SRD

Festivals/ awards:

Premiere at the Berlin FF, programme FORUM in 2010 ;

Copenhagen 2010 - CPH PIX ;

Lithuanian Cinema Academy award «Silver Craine» for the best film, best director, best actress of the year 2010;

The Best film nomination in Tridens Baltic Feature Film Competition, Tallinn, 2010;

Best film award in CIS and Baltic states film festival in «Kinoshok» in Anapa, 2010

Cinédécouvertes / L'ÂGE D'OR , Bruxelles, , 2010;

Pesaro Film Festival, , 2010;

Moscow Film Festival, , 2010;

Haifa Film Festival, , 2010;

Festival do Rio , Brasil, 2010;

Moscow Film Festival «Tomorrow» 2010;

Festival «Cinema Nova», Bruxelles, 2010;

IFF «Molodist», Kiev, 2010;

Bergen International FF (BIFF), 2010;

Villa do Conde - CURTAS METRAGENS, , 2010;

Kaunas IFF, 2010;

GÖTEBORG IFF, , 2011;

Kino Pavasaris IFF in Vilnius, 2011, etc.

As the producer:

Short fiction films:

1992 m. “Išakėtas krantas”/ “ Harrowed Coast ”, dir.Tomas Donela

Special jury mention in Algere

1992 m.“Švilpukas” / „The Wistler“ dir. A.Lioranchas

1995 m. “Likusios dienos” / „The days that are left“ dir. K.Vildzhiunas

Documentary films:

1989 m. “Praėjusios dienos atminimui”/ „In The Memory of A Day Gone By“,dir. Sh.Bartas

Main price in Kiev, in 1990;

Special jury award, audience award in Amsterdam in 1990

1991 m. “Neregių žemė”/ “Earth of Blind” dir. A.Stonys / Felix ’92 for the best European documentary film;

The best experimental film in Oberhausen in 1992

1992 m. “Rudens sniegas”/ „Autumn Snow“ dir. V.Navasaitis

Secon audience award in Babelsberg student film festivali n 1992;

SCAM price in „Cinema du Reel“, Paris 1993

Third price in „Balticum“, Bornholm 1993

1992 m. “Griuvėsių apaštalas” / “Appostal of Ruin” dir. A.Stonys

The best film in „Mediawave”, Györ 1993

The best image in Mons 1993

1992 m. “Aukštyn upe”/ “Up by the river” dir. A.Jevdokimovas

Special jury award, Piarnu 1992

1993 m. “Baltojo laiko keleiviai”/ „Wanderers of white time“ dir. R.Leipus,

1994 m. “Tinklai”/ „The Nets“ dir. A.Jevdokimovas

1994 m. “Pasiansas”/ „Pasians“, dir. T.Donela

1997 m. “Pavasaris” / „The Spring“ , dir. V.Navasaitis, produced by „Studio Kinema“ together with „Sodaperaga“

The best short documentary film in Cinema du Reel, Paris 1997;

The best documentary film in L’Alternatyva, Barselona 1997;

Special jury mention in „ Films of Environment“, Paris 1997,

The main price in Oberhausen, in 1998

1997 m. “Praėjusio filmo atminimui”/ „In memory of the film“ dir. A.Jevdokimovas

Feature films:

1991 - “Trys dienos” / “Three Days“

1995 -“Koridorius” / „The Corridor“

1995 - “Mūsų nedaug” / „Few of Us“

1996 - “Namai”/ „The House“

2001 m. “Laisvė”/ „Freedom“

As an actor:

1995 – „The Corridor“ - protogonist

Dir.Sharunas Bartas

1999 – „Pola X“ - The Chief“

Dir. Leos Carax

2010 – „Eastern Drift“ – Gena
